title: Sanskrit Words in English
description: From yoga to nirvana, explore the ancient Sanskrit roots that have influenced countless English words!

questions.question: The word 'yoga' comes from Sanskrit. What does 'yoga' literally mean?
Which English word meaning 'a state of perfect happiness' comes from the Sanskrit 'nirvana'?
The word 'karma' is from Sanskrit. What does 'karma' literally mean?
Which English word for a sacred syllable used in meditation comes from Sanskrit?
The word 'mantra' is Sanskrit. What does it literally mean?
Which English word for an energy center in the body comes from the Sanskrit 'cakra' (wheel)?
The word 'avatar' comes from Sanskrit 'avatara.' What does 'avatara' mean?
options: A descent (of a deity to earth)

questions.question: Which English word for a type of body posture in yoga comes from the Sanskrit 'asana'?
The word 'juggernaut' comes from the Sanskrit 'Jagannatha.' What does 'Jagannatha' mean?
Which English word for a place of learning comes from the Sanskrit 'vihara' (through Pali)?
The word 'sugar' ultimately traces back to the Sanskrit 'sharkara.' What did 'sharkara' originally refer to?
options: Ground or gritty substance (gravel, then sugar)

questions.question: Which English word for a large pepper comes from the Sanskrit 'pippali' (through Latin 'piper')?
The word 'mandala' is Sanskrit. What does it represent?
options: A circle or cosmic diagram symbolizing the universe

questions.question: Which English word meaning 'truthfulness' or 'non-violent resistance' was popularized by Gandhi from Sanskrit?
The English word 'mother' is related to the Sanskrit 'matar.' This connection exists because both languages belong to which language family?
